text.*:
Kovai
Native to Papua New Guinea
Region Umboi Island, Morobe Province
Native speakers
 6,000 (2011)[1]
Language family
Trans–New Guinea
  • Finisterre–Huon
    • Huon
      • Kovai
Language codes
ISO 639-3 kqb
Glottolog kova1243[2]

Kovai (Kobai, Kowai) is a Papuan language spoken on Umboi Island, halfway between mainland Papua New Guinea and the island of New Britain, and mostly within the caldera of that volcanic island.

Contents

  • 1 Phonology
    • 1.1 Vowels (orthographic)
    • 1.2 Consonants (orthographic)
  • 2 References
  • 3 External links

Phonology[edit]

Vowels (orthographic)[edit]

Front Central Back
Close i u
Mid e o
Open a

Consonants (orthographic)[edit]

Labial Alveolar Palatal Velar
Voiceless plosive p t k
Voiced plosive b g
Voiced nasal m n ng
Voiceless fricative s
Voiced fricative z
Voiced trill r
Approximant w l y

References[edit]

  1. ^ Kovai at Ethnologue (18th ed., 2015)
  2. ^ Hammarström, Harald; Forkel, Robert; Haspelmath, Martin, eds. (2017). "Kovai". Glottolog 3.0. Jena, Germany: Max Planck Institute for the Science of Human History. 

External links[edit]

For a list of words relating to Kovai language, see the Kovai language category of words in Wiktionary, the free dictionary.
